definition: to prohibit/to ban/to suppress
see 山查[shan1 zha1]
surname Zha
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)
to endure
to prohibit/to forbid

sentences.english: Jiang Jieshi has also implemented the policy he banned, banned the book not less than.
sentences.chinese: 蔣介石也實行禁書政策，他查禁的書不會少於清朝。
查禁教友派信徒和女巫。

sentences.english: They threatened to ban the book.
This book was banned by the early ruler of Song Dynasty, before long it was published.
sentences.chinese: 此書問世後不久即遭到宋初統治者查禁。

sentences.english: A private press was forbidden, and political parties banned.
sentences.chinese: 一傢俬人出版社被查禁，政黨活動被禁止。

sentences.english: The author of the report had no intention of outlawing the game.
sentences.chinese: 那位壇友本無意讓法律查禁該遊戲。

definition: to totally prohibit/to put an end to
to smuggle
to suppress/to crack down on/to prohibit
to punish (someone)/to take disciplinary action against (someone)
reaction/reactionary
to crack down on/to take severe measures against
to violate a prohibition or ban/prohibited/illicit
to investigate thoroughly/to carefully inspect/to verify/to ferret out (undesirable elements)
to prohibit performance
to strike a severe blow/to crack down/to take strong measures
to ban smoking/to quit smoking/to prohibit cooking/prohibition on opium (esp. in China from 1729)
to raid/to search (for criminal)
to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
to investigate strictly
to violate a ban
to take inventory of and confiscate a criminal's possessions/to search and confiscate (forbidden items)/to raid
